content: tru dat President Obama’s First 70 Days It really does all make sense. By Victor Davis Hanson Read the whole article:'http://article.nationalreview.com/?q=YWI4ZDcwMzNiZmQ5MmQ4MzkwNjEyOGEyMGU3N2JmMjY=&w=MA==' If you believed that the story of the United States is more a narrative of gender, race, and class oppression than of brave souls promoting liberty and trying to reify the promise of the Constitution, then you would have empathy for fellow victims of such endemic Western oppression ....... If you believed that the traditions and customs of the United States are largely a story of the oppressed overcoming the perniciousness of the privileged, rather than the collective efforts of the many to stop tyranny, then you would talk about past oppression, past victimization, and past unfairness far more than you would evoke Shiloh, the Meuse-Argonne, or Iwo Jima. If you believed that the United States is hardly exceptional, but merely one nation not all that different from others, then you would have confidence in the aggregate wisdom of the United Nations, and the cultural and economic paradigms provided by the nations of the European Union ....... In other words, if you believed as President Obama and many of his advisors do, then you would do what Obama and his advisors are now doing. In other words, if you believed as President Obama and many of his advisors do, then you would do what Obama and his advisors are now doing.

content: quote: If you believed that the United States is hardly exceptional, but merely one nation not all that different from others, then you would have confidence in the aggregate wisdom of the United Nations, and the cultural and economic paradigms provided by the nations of the European Union ....... Probably nothing burns my butt more than the socialist view of "we're all the same." BS! No, we're not! America is the MOST blessed country on the planet. MUCH of that has to do with our military - the real backbone of our country. Heck, the backbone of the planet. "Anything easy ain't worth a damn." Woody Hayes (RIP)

content: quote: Originally posted by WepsFP: quote: Originally posted by Mom2APAJ: My system glitched before I could type my reply of... Typical Dem/liberal mindset... don't take responsibility, blame it on someone else. How much responsibility are you taking for the screwed up condition this country is in? After all, the majority of the blame rest with failed Republican policies and a rubber stamping President. Rest assured Mommy....The United States is on the mend. The economy is recovering, other countries are slowly respecting US again. Best of all, your failed party is virtually incapable of causing further damage. Let us not forget LCDR, that the Republicans controlled both houses of Congress for six out of the eight years of Bush tenure. I find it incredibly amusing, that the Dems get all the blame for all of the country's failures, in only controlling the Congress just two of those eight years. And it won't matter if President Obama/administration is successful in fixing the economic woes. The folks who despise him the most made themselves very clear about their distaste for the man back during the November elections. I don't like to use the word hate, however, hatred for this man started a long time ago. That mind set simply won't change regardless how successful he is. Yep, it's really that simple with the mind set of the hard core neocon-whingers. Since "mind sets" are literally set in stone by a lot of folks on this site, it makes me wonder, why even bother to argue against one another? No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: quote: Originally posted by Mom2APAJ: My system glitched before I could type my reply of... Typical Dem/liberal mindset... don't take responsibility, blame it on someone else. Do you even listen to the President? Have you heard a single thing he has said? President Obama: "Washington is all in a tizzy and everybody is pointing fingers at each other and saying it's their fault, the Democrats' fault, the Republicans' fault," he said at a town hall meeting Wednesday. "Listen, I'll take responsibility. I'm the President." "I will be held accountable. I have got four years," the president said. "I think a year from now people are going to see that we are starting to make some progress, but there is still going to be some pain out there. If I do not have this [economic recovery] done in three years, then there is going to be a one-term proposition
